name: Clin M Breast
title: Clinical M
notes:
**Note 1:**  Involvement of supraclavicular (transverse cervical) lymph nodes is coded as regional lymph node involvement. See N (regional lymph nodes).

**Note 2:**  Cases in which there are no distant metastases as determined by clinical and/or radiographic methods are designated cM0. Cases in which one or more distant metastases are identified by clinical and/or radiographic methods are designated cM1. A case is classified as clinically free of metastasis (cM0) unless there is documented evidence of metastasis by clinical means or by biopsy of a metastatic site (pathologic).  Use cM0 if there is no documentation available for any staging assessment, or if there is reasonable doubt that the tumor is no longer localized and there is no documentation of distant metastasis.

Isolated tumor cells found in bone marrow

No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis, BUT 
deposits of molecularly or microscopically detected tumor cells in circulating blood, bone marrow or other non-regional nodal tissue that are 0.2 millimeters (mm) or less in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastasis

Stated as M0(i+)

    Lung
    Ovary
    Satellite nodule(s) in skin other than primary breast
